intro: Turbinicarpus ysabelae, commonly known as the Ysabel's turbinicarpus, is a species of cactus native to the Sonoran Desert in Mexico. It is characterized by its globular, ribbed stems that are typically green with a waxy coating. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable addition to desert gardens.
